title: Executive Control of Cognitive Processes in Task Switching
summary: Switching between tasks involves two distinct stages: 'goal shifting' (deciding to do it) and 'rule activation' (loading the rules for the new task). This incurs a significant time and accuracy cost, which increases with task complexity.

effectiveness_metrics.description: Frequent multitasking drastically reduces overall efficiency due to these cumulative micro-delays.

mechanisms.name: Goal Shifting
mechanisms.description: The executive process of disengaging from one goal and engaging another.

mechanisms.name: Rule Activation
mechanisms.description: The cognitive 'boot-up' time required to remember how to perform the new task.

mechanisms.name: Switching Penalty
mechanisms.description: The loss of performance immediately following a switch.

actionable_strategies.name: Batching Protocol
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Suggest 'Email Mode' or 'Reading Mode' where the user does ONLY that type of task for 20 mins to avoid rule-switching costs.

actionable_strategies.name: Single-Task Lock-In
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: During a sprint, visually obscure or hide all other UI elements (nav bars, other lists) to prevent visual cues that trigger goal shifting.
